result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin David Houston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin David Houston is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin David Houston was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final notice sent, due 6-1-17. cah

DE's mother called to state that she is unable to make a pymt on the wicourts.gov site.  DE's mother was given the GPNet website & advised that his late July pymt of $25 is due immediately or he will be warranted on 7-29-16. jaf
Final notice sent, due 7-28-16. cah
CC: DA, DE, Atty Kucinski, North Hudson PD. hml
DE appeared.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 5-18-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Benjamin David Houston appeared. Case called at 10:43 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a pre trial conference but there is a resolution. Atty Kucinski recites agreement. State in agreement and has no objection to expungement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 2 Poss. Drug Para. in 15CM735. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia in 15CM735. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM735. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. Crt orders:

On Count 2:

- Fine in the amount of $243.00. Set up a payment plan

- DNA Surcharge in the amount of $200.00

- DNA Sample

- May apply for expungement after a period of 1 year if remains law biding and all financial obligations are paid in full
filed by ADA M. Kelly. gme
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
Atty. J. Kucinski. gme

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly & Kindra Seifert,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Benjamin David Houston appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ramona H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
